sentence.Network_en: A woman picks them up and seals them in plastic bags.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个女人把它们捡起来放入几只密封的塑料袋中。

sentence.Network_en: Clubbing baby seals to death for their pelts is wrong.
sentence.Network_cn: 为了获得海豹皮而用棍棒打死幼海豹是不道德的。

sentence.Network_en: Check seals on fridges and freezers regularly.
sentence.Network_cn: 定期检查冰箱和冷冻柜的密封装置。

entry.def: When you seal an envelope, you close it by folding part of it over and sticking it down, so that it cannot be opened without being torn.

example.ex: He sealed the envelope and put on a stamp...
example.tran: 他封住信封并贴上一张邮票。

example.ex: Write your letter and seal it in a blank envelope...
example.tran: 信写好后把它装进空白信封里封好。

entry.tran: 封住(容器、开口);把…密封(进容器)
entry.def: If you seal a container or an opening, you cover it with something in order to prevent air, liquid, or other material getting in or out. If you seal something in a container, you put it inside and then close the container tightly.

example.ex: She merely filled the containers, sealed them with a cork, and pasted on labels...
example.tran: 她只是装满容器，用软木塞封住，然后贴上标签。

example.ex: A woman picks them up and seals them in plastic bags.
example.tran: 一个女人把它们捡起来放入几只密封的塑料袋中。

entry.def: The seal on a container or opening is the part where it has been sealed.

example.ex: When assembling the pie, wet the edges where the two crusts join, to form a seal.
example.tran: 在包馅饼时，先把两片馅饼皮边沿接头部分弄湿，再将其捏合。

entry.def: A seal is a device or a piece of material, for example in a machine, which closes an opening tightly so that air, liquid, or other substances cannot get in or out.

example.ex: Check seals on fridges and freezers regularly.
example.tran: 定期检查冰箱和冷冻柜的密封装置。

entry.def: A seal is something such as a piece of sticky paper or wax that is fixed to a container or door and must be broken before the container or door can be opened.

example.ex: The seal on the box broke when it fell from its hiding-place...
example.tran: 盒子从隐藏处掉落时，封口裂开了。

example.ex: Protestors banged on the sides of the lorry and broke customs seals on the doors.
example.tran: 抗议者们猛砸卡车的侧面，并且撕掉了车门上的海关封条。

entry.def: A seal is a special mark or design, for example on a document, representing someone or something. It may be used to show that something is genuine or officially approved.

example.ex: ...a supply of note paper bearing the Presidential seal...
example.tran: 一批盖有总统印章的便条纸

example.ex: The best wines are entitled to a numbered seal of quality.
example.tran: 上等葡萄酒可以盖上带编号的优质产品印章。

entry.def: If someone in authority seals an area, they stop people entering or passing through it, for example by placing barriers in the way.

example.ex: The soldiers were deployed to help paramilitary police seal the border...
example.tran: 部署士兵协助准军事警察封锁边境。

example.ex: A wide area round the two-storey building is sealed to all traffic except the emergency services.
example.tran: 那个两层建筑周围的大片区域被封锁，只有提供应急服务的车辆可以通行。

entry.def: To seal something means to make it definite or confirm how it is going to be.

example.ex: McLaren are close to sealing a deal with Renault...
example.tran: 麦克拉伦即将与雷诺达成一笔交易。

example.ex: A General Election will be held which will seal his destiny one way or the other...
example.tran: 一场决定他命运的大选即将举行。

entry.def: If something sets or puts the seal on something, it makes it definite or confirms how it is going to be.

example.ex: Such a visit may set the seal on a new relationship between the two governments...
example.tran: 这样的一次访问可能会使两国政府间确立新关系。

example.ex: They see this election as a chance to put the final seal on the defeat of communism.
example.tran: 他们把这次选举看作是彻底击败共产主义的一次机会。

entry.tran: 盖上印信的;不能拆开看的;保密的
entry.def: If a document is under seal, it is in a sealed envelope and cannot be looked at, for example because it is private.

example.ex: Because the transcript is still under seal, I am precluded by law from discussing the evidence.
example.tran: 副本仍未公开，按照法律规定我不能讨论这项证据。

entry.def: A seal is a large animal with a rounded body and flat legs called flippers. Seals eat fish and live in and near the sea, usually in cold parts of the world.

auth_sentence.content: He believes what makes Seals special is their versatility.
auth_sentence.res_content: He believes what makes Seals special is their versatility.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He believes what makes Seals special is their versatility.

auth_sentence.content: You can also see seals at several National Trust locations.
auth_sentence.res_content: You can also see seals at several National Trust locations.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You can also see seals at several National Trust locations.

auth_sentence.content: Dead whales, seals n bears in the high arctic.
auth_sentence.res_content: Dead whales, seals n bears in the high arctic.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Dead whales, seals n bears in the high arctic.
